author: {'steamid': '76561199010042150', 'num_games_owned': 3874, 'num_reviews': 2454, 'playtime_forever': 226, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 226, 'last_played': 1657069107}
review:
I am 32 years old.

My ex-wife and I have a daughter together, and we adopted our son together. Both are now 4 years old.

When we were going through our separation, I felt lost and unhappy. I was self-destructive. One day, I was so angry with everything spiraling out of control that I punched a concrete wall in a moment of overwhelming emotion. This resulted in breaking my fifth metacarpal in my right hand‚Äîthe hand I worked with, played games with, and used to carry my children to bed‚Äîthe hand I desperately needed to ensure I could continue providing.

Upon learning the severity of the self-inflicted damage, I became almost suicidal. Keep in mind that just a few months before this, I was the happiest man, with no history of depression or anxiety. I had never experienced anger outbursts, nor was I the type to break down and cry, but I was in a tough situation that truly prevented me from seeing the light on the other side.

With nothing better to do, I looked for a game I could play WITH ONE HAND while recovering. Somehow, I stumbled upon this game and read some of the comments. I decided it was worth a try... I must admit I didn't beat the game, nor did I play as much as some of you. In fact, I may have played this game for only a day or two. That being said, after doing so, I had a new joy and hope for life. I managed to leave behind the pain and suffering that had been thrust upon me. I could experience the joy and happiness of other people. I relaxed for 5 ‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô• minutes listening to this music, long enough to realize that I would be okay.

After realizing this, I turned off the game and went back to work. My hand hurt a lot, but I was motivated. I stopped feeling so sorry for myself and became the father I needed to be at that moment, not the weak boy I was behaving like.

Today, I am close friends with the mother of my children. We don't fight, argue, or say hurtful things to each other. We are parents and friends.

Now I have 3 children. My third child is, wait, ALSO 4 YEARS OLD. The woman I am with was going through a very similar situation at the time of my separation, and we just unexpectedly stumbled into each other's lives. We have been dating for a year and are very happy together.

Moral of the story: you never know what life has in store for you, and if I had given up when all odds were against me, I wouldn't be where I am today. This silly little game helped me realize that.

Thank you.

review: I have a very special interest in 3D platform games. There are different game modes, 5 in total. As the mode progresses, I can say that the game diversifies thanks to our increasing abilities and different features. These features and skills are introduced to you in sections that change as you progress and draw a practical way for you to use them. In other words, I can say that they actually saved the tutorial part well by showing you chapter by chapter. It may be a bit difficult for the difficulty part of the game. I would be lying if I said there were no sweat points. I recommend those who love platform games to take a look.

review:
Byte Family, her biri kendine √∂zg√º zorluklarƒ± ve hedefleri olan √ße≈üitli oyun modlarƒ± sunan heyecan verici bir 3D platform oyunudur. Oyun Volens Nolens Games tarafƒ±ndan geli≈ütirilmi≈ü ve ProPixel Games tarafƒ±ndan yayƒ±nlanmƒ±≈ütƒ±r. Oyunda, siber d√ºnya ByteFamily'yi sisteme binlerce vir√ºs bula≈ütƒ±ran Ermes Boss adlƒ± gizemli bir yabancƒ±dan kurtarmak i√ßin antivir√ºs biti Pixel'e yardƒ±m etmelisiniz.

Ke≈üfedilecek be≈ü oyun modu var ve ilerledik√ße yeni beceri ve yeteneklerin kilidini a√ßacaksƒ±nƒ±z. M√ºcadele modunda, farklƒ± seviyelerde gezinmeli ve deƒüerli bilgiler saƒülayabilecek NPC'lerle konu≈ümalƒ±sƒ±nƒ±z. Rekor modu, bir Alicop s√ºr√ºs√ºnden ka√ßƒ±nmak ve bir R3302 √ºzerinde m√ºmk√ºn olduƒüunca uzun s√ºre hayatta kalmak i√ßin becerilerinizi kullanmanƒ±zƒ± gerektirir. Hapishane modunda, sizi ele ge√ßirmeden √∂nce t√ºm vir√ºsleri ortadan kaldƒ±rmalƒ±sƒ±nƒ±z. Bonus M modu, kendiniz ke≈üfetmeniz gereken gizli bir moddur. Son olarak, Record Pro modunda, m√ºmk√ºn olduƒüunca uzun s√ºre hayatta kalmak i√ßin Infinity Jump tekniƒüini kullanmalƒ±sƒ±nƒ±z.

Oyun, kademeli olarak yeni unsurlarƒ± tanƒ±tan ve oyun mekaniƒüi i√ßinde becerilerinizi ve yeteneklerinizi geli≈ütirme fƒ±rsatlarƒ± sunan bir √∂ƒürenme eƒürisine sahiptir. Her seviyede zorluk artƒ±yor ve ilerlemek i√ßin daha fazla d√º≈ü√ºnme, muhakeme ve beceri kullanmanƒ±zƒ± gerektiriyor.

Genel olarak, Byte Family benzersiz ve zorlu bir oyun deneyimi sunan keyifli bir oyun. Eƒüer 3D platform oyunlarƒ±nƒ± seviyorsanƒ±z, kesinlikle denemelisiniz!

author: {'steamid': '76561198030784015', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11208, 'playtime_forever': 269, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 269, 'last_played': 1666086259}
review:
Byte Family is yet another construction kit template copy+paste from serial shovelware pushers, Volens Nolens Games.  These guys do nothing but copy premade game templates and game tutorials, fill out a few things/stamp out basic levels using the construction kit templates, slap on an asset flipped set of sprites/assets, and dump them on Steam and into DailyIndieGame bundles as cash grabs.  Trying to get paid for someone else's game templates, assets... at best, this is shovelware, at worst, it's a scam/cash grab.

Byte Family is yet another of literally thousands of 2D retro pixel platformers infesting Steam and lowering the average quality of all video games everywhere.  This shovelware platformer looks to have been copied from a basic Unity template, with a few craptastic, phoned in sprites slapped on it lazily.  I mean, I guess this counts as being a genuine attempt at making some kind of "game" instead of a direct asset flip or more obvious copy + paste of a game package like Volens Nolens usually, do, but it's still crap shovelware with no merit as a game for gamers.

From a technical perspective, the game doesn't meet basic minimum requirements that most PC gamers expect as standard.

A choice was made to use obsolete, decades old retro pixel "art" as a substitute for contemporary PC graphics.  It's unclear if this is due to lack of budget or talent, regardless, the overall visual quality of the game is extremely low as a result.

While there are options to change the resolution for the game, all this does is scale up the simplistic low quality art assets used to make the game, which makes little or no difference to the graphics quality.  Without any other substantial graphics tweaks, it's not possible for gamers to improve the mediocre 2D visuals.

The controls can't be customised, which will be an annoyance for many, but it can also render the game unplayable for differently-abled gamers.

These technical defects push this game below acceptable standards for any modern PC game.

Byte Family has an overly optimistic price of around $4 USD, it's not worth it given the defects and shortcomings with the product, especially considering the sheer number of completely free, much higher quality games on Steam, and the unethical nature of the developer/publisher.

author: {'steamid': '76561198245441650', 'num_games_owned': 361, 'num_reviews': 208, 'playtime_forever': 85, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 85, 'last_played': 1627155716}
review:
On the bright side this game costs next to nothing.... but if im being honest it also has next to nothing.

The dialog was practically non-existent and 3/5 times there was a major typo.

Game play was terrible because it consisted of getting spawn killed, slippery movement, little to no combat ability despite tons of enemies, lengthy segments in which the hard part is at the very end, a prison mode which appears to be a "kill all enemies" type thing but does not explain the purpose, and the best part..... parts where you NEED TO DIE to use respawn invulnerability to continue on. 

Now if the game had good visual content that would work too, but its visual content consists of very retro characters and is pretty generic. I don't usually judge games off of there looks but since this game does not have any other qualities this could have been the only thing riding for it. 

The music is decent at best and literally sounds like me messing around with a piano at worst. (and i am not good at piano)

The "skills" are just generic movements that would be standard in most other platformers....

So over all its just not worth picking up in the first place.

author: {'steamid': '76561198201887747', 'num_games_owned': 159, 'num_reviews': 41, 'playtime_forever': 126, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 67, 'last_played': 1622508664}
review: Underrated game. I honestly think that Byte Family may be the most bang for your buck, literal buck. Boasting a price tag of $0.99 its a cheap and fun pixel platformer that has lots of charm. I honestly only got it because it was so cheap and my friends and I we're messing around but when we got to playing it it was actually a really good game. It has some really fun platforming mechanics and a charming art style. it gets a little hard but its not unbeatable. I think this game is a hidden gem among hidden gems and should have more attention. It isn't some Super Meatboy, or Celeste, but its still pretty damn good.
